definition: beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
see 莎草[suo1 cao3]/see 摩莎[mo2 suo1]

sentences.english: In Greek mythology, Medusa was a female character with snakes for hair.
sentences.chinese: 在希臘神話中，美杜莎是長着蛇發的女怪。

sentences.english: What it was and he told me that it was Medusa, the Gorgon.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴我那是蛇發女怪美杜莎。

sentences.english: You could think of Medusa as Milton's counter-muse.
sentences.chinese: 你可以把美杜莎看作是彌爾頓最重要的繆斯女神。

sentences.english: Medusa can turn men into stone.
sentences.chinese: 美杜莎可以把人變成石頭。

sentences.english: Interfaces are your mirror in dealing with Medusa.
sentences.chinese: 接口就是對付美杜莎的鏡子。

sentences.english: Me that it was Medusa, the Gorgon.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴我那是蛇發女怪美杜莎。

sentences.english: Many fear the petrifying attack of the Medusa.
sentences.chinese: 許多人害怕美杜莎的石化攻擊。

definition: Lucifer (Satan's name before his fall in Jewish and Christian mythology)
leech/bloodsucking vermin/vampire (translated European notion)/fig. cruel exploiter, esp. a capitalist exploiting the workers
Titan (race of deities in Greek mythology, moon of Saturn etc)
